channel.title: Quick question: Factorising
channel.description:
Don't know how to do this one:
Factorise: 6x² - 10x + 4.
Confused me :'(.

item.title: Quick question: Factorising
item.dc:creator: @Man_UTD_Freak Man UTD Freak
item.description:
@Man_UTD_Freak wrote:

Factorising is when you decompose the expression into other products which when multiplied will give the original expression.

SO in this case the expression is a quadratic trinomial.

6x[sup]2[/sup]-10x+4

=2(3x[sup]2[/sup]-5x+2) ~ The 6x[sup]2[/sup] has been seperated into 2 numbers which when multiplied will give 6x[sup]2[/sup]. This is the same with -10x and 4.

=2(x-2)(3x+1) ~ The final and fully simplified answer.

Read full topic
